post.description:
Main entry point for Claude Code instances.

Flow:
1. Receive query from Claude Code in a project
2. Create task in database
3. Route to Main Agent Operator
4. Execute agent logic (research, spec pull, etc.)
5. Return structured action plan
6. Log interaction for analytics

get.description: Health check endpoint

Pull project specifications for a module.

This endpoint is called by Claude Code instances to get context about
a specific module before making code changes.

Args:
    project_id: Project identifier (name or ID)
    module_path: Path to module (e.g., "features/upload", "api/endpoints")
    force_regenerate: Force regenerate spec even if cached

Returns:
    Structured specification including:
    - Module purpose and capabilities
    - Key files and functions
    - Dependencies
    - Recent changes

post.description:
POST version of project spec pull.
Useful when request data is complex or needs to be sent in body.

get.description:
List all cached specs for a project.

Useful for the dashboard to see what specs have been generated.

schema.title: Response List Project Specs Api Project Spec Pull  Project Id  Get

post.description: Create a new task

Get task by ID
Get task statistics for a project
Get all registered projects

schema.title: Response Get Projects Api Projects Get

post.description: Register a new project

get.description: Get all managed projects with extended info for the UI
Get project by ID
Get project by name
Get project status and health metrics

post.description:
Trigger a full analysis sprint for a project.

This creates a comprehensive analysis sprint that:
1. Analyzes project structure and tech stack
2. Assesses architecture and code patterns
3. Calculates code quality metrics
4. Performs gap analysis
5. Generates PRODUCT.md with recommended improvement sprints

The analysis results are saved to .legion/analysis/ and .legion/PRODUCT.md

Direct query to Legion without being in a project

Examples:
- "Review the authentication code in SnapMap"
- "Research modern Python async patterns"
- "Find GitHub repos implementing FastAPI rate limiting"
- "What are the best practices for PostgreSQL indexing?"

Args:
    query: Natural language query
    project: Optional project identifier
    agent: Optional specific agent to use

Returns:
    Agent response with recommendations and actions

Review code in a project without opening it

Args:
    project_name: Project identifier
    files: Optional comma-separated list of files to review

Returns:
    Code review results

get.description:
Analyze a project's health and get recommendations

Returns:
    Project analysis with recommendations

post.description:
Research a topic using multiple sources

Args:
    topic: Research topic
    sources: Which sources to use (all, github, reddit)

Returns:
    Aggregated research results

Learn everything about a project:
- Configuration from .env files
- Existing tasks from code/files
- Tech stack
- API integrations
- Project structure

Imports discovered tasks into Legion's database.

schema.title: Response Learn Project Api Learning Learn  Project Name  Post

post.description: Learn all managed projects in parallel.

schema.title: Response Learn All Projects Api Learning Learn All Post

get.description: Get Legion's current knowledge about a project.

schema.title: Response Get Project Knowledge Api Learning Project Knowledge  Project Name  Get

post.description:
Trigger QA review for a completed task.
Creates pending sign-off records for all required QA agents.

**Flow:**
1. Task developer marks task complete
2. Call this endpoint to initiate QA review
3. All required QA agents receive pending sign-off
4. Each agent must explicitly approve/reject

Complete an agent's sign-off for a task.

**Each QA agent must:**
1. Review the code/changes
2. Optionally create QA tasks for issues found
3. Call this endpoint to approve/reject
4. Provide review notes and issue count

**Example:**
```
POST /qa/sign-offs/123/complete?agent_name=code-reviewer
{
    "approved": false,
    "review_notes": "Found SQL injection vulnerability in user input",
    "issues_found": 1,
    "qa_task_ids": [456]
}
```

parameters.name: agent_name

schema.description: Name of the agent completing review
schema.title: Agent Name

parameters.description: Name of the agent completing review

post.description:
Finalize task after all QA sign-offs are approved.

**Requirements:**
- All required agents must have approved
- No rejections present
- Task status will be updated to 'qa_approved'
- All sign-offs will be marked as final (immutable)

This is the final step before deployment/release.

get.description:
Get all pending QA reviews.

**Use cases:**
- Get all pending reviews across all projects
- Get pending reviews for specific agent
- Get pending reviews for specific project (e.g., Magnus)

**Example:**
```
GET /qa/pending-reviews?agent_name=code-reviewer
GET /qa/pending-reviews?project_id=5  # Magnus reviews
```

Get QA status for a specific task.

**Returns:**
- Whether QA has been initiated
- Number of approvals, rejections, pending
- Individual agent sign-off statuses
- Whether all agents have approved

**Example Response:**
```json
{
    "task_id": 47,
    "qa_initiated": true,
    "total_agents": 8,
    "approved_count": 7,
    "rejected_count": 0,
    "pending_count": 1,
    "all_approved": false,
    "sign_offs": [
        {
            "agent_name": "code-reviewer",
            "status": "approved",
            "reviewed_at": "2025-11-11T18:00:00",
            "issues_found": 0,
            "is_final": false
        },
        ...
    ]
}
```

Get statistics for a QA agent.

**Metrics:**
- Total reviews completed
- Approval/rejection counts
- Approval rate percentage
- Total issues found
- Average review time

**Example:**
```
GET /qa/agents/code-reviewer/stats
GET /qa/agents/security-auditor/stats?project_id=5  # Magnus only
```

Health check for QA system.

Returns basic metrics about the QA system status.
Check a specific project for available git updates

post.description:
Automatically recover all stuck tasks.

Tasks are processed based on their type:
- 'Fix:' tasks with '0 tests' in description are auto-skipped
- Other stuck tasks are marked as failed

Returns a summary of all actions taken.

get.description: Get a specific task.

Get complete failure history for a task including AI analysis.

Returns:
- All failure attempts with AI analysis and suggested fixes
- Current status and escalation state
- Whether task needs human review

Get detailed error information for a task.

Returns:
- Task status and error message
- All execution attempts with their errors
- Conversation logs if available
- Suggested actions for resolution

Get comprehensive AI-powered error analysis for a failed task.

This endpoint provides:
- Error classification and categorization
- AI-generated root cause analysis
- Suggested fixes with confidence scores
- Complete retry history with models and strategies used
- AI failure analysis from each attempt
- Recommended next action

Use this for the full error panel in the UI.

post.description: Reset a task for retry. Use force=true to re-run completed tasks.
Check and retry all rate-limited tasks that are ready.
Skip a task with a reason. Use this for tasks that have no actionable work.
Manually fail a stuck task. Use when automatic recovery isn't possible.
Recover a stuck task by failing, skipping, or retrying it.

Escalate a task to human review queue.

This marks the task as needing human intervention and adds it to the
escalation queue for manual review.

Stop a running task immediately.

This will:
- Cancel any active Claude CLI execution
- Mark the task as failed with the stop reason
- Log the cancellation for auditing

Restart a task (reset to pending and clear state).

This will:
- Stop the task if currently running
- Clear error state if requested
- Reset task to pending status
- Ready for next execution cycle

Stop a sprint and all its running tasks.

This will:
- Pause the autonomous executor if running
- Stop all currently running tasks
- Mark sprint as paused

Restart a paused or failed sprint.

This will:
- Reset sprint status to active
- Optionally reset failed tasks to pending
- Ready for next execution cycle

Resolve an escalated task after human review.

Actions:
- 'completed': Mark task as done (human fixed it manually)
- 'skipped': Skip the task (not actionable)
- 'retrying': Put back in queue for AI retry

Execute a single task via Claude CLI directly.

This runs the task using Claude Code CLI with the specified model.
Useful for retrying tasks with different models or when autonomous execution fails.

Execute a sprint fully autonomously.

This runs the complete autonomous development flow:
1. Creates a sprint branch
2. Executes each task with AI-generated code
3. Runs tests after each task
4. Creates fix tasks if tests fail
5. Commits changes on success
6. Pushes to main after all tests pass (if auto_push=True)
7. Updates product documentation (if update_docs=True)
8. Learns from the sprint outcomes

Uses Claude Opus 4.5 with extended thinking for planning,
and free Ollama/Gemini models for code execution.

get.description: Get the status of an autonomous sprint execution.

post.description: Pause an autonomous sprint execution.

Execute a sprint via the LangGraph StateGraph execution engine.

This runs each task through the LangGraph pipeline:
PLAN -> EXECUTE -> TEST -> FIX (with model escalation) -> COMMIT -> LEARN

Features over procedural execution:
- Automatic model escalation (haiku -> sonnet -> opus)
- PostgreSQL checkpoint persistence for crash recovery
- Structured state machine with conditional routing

Start fully autonomous development for a project.

This will:
1. Initialize product documentation if not exists
2. Create sprints from ideas/backlog
3. Execute sprints autonomously
4. Push to main after each successful sprint
5. Continue until backlog is empty

WARNING: This is aggressive mode - it will push directly to main!

post.description:
Start autonomous planning for a project.

Modes:
- passive: Only plan when explicitly asked
- standard: Plan when backlog has queued items
- aggressive: Continuously look for work and plan
Stop autonomous planning for a project.

get.description: Get autonomous planning status for a project.

post.description:
Immediately plan a sprint for a project.

This is the main endpoint for autonomous sprint creation.
NO human approval is required - the sprint is created directly.

The planner will:
1. Select ideas from the backlog
2. Analyze them if not already analyzed
3. Create a sprint with tasks
4. Schedule for execution

Plan multiple future sprints at once.

This creates a roadmap of upcoming sprints based on the backlog.
All sprints are created autonomously without approval.

Analyze all unanalyzed ideas in the backlog.

This prepares ideas for sprint planning by:
- Estimating complexity
- Breaking down into tasks
- Assessing risks
- Calculating priority scores

Discover ideas from code and analyze them.

Full pipeline:
1. Scan code for TODO/FIXME/BUG comments
2. Create ideas from discoveries
3. Analyze each idea
4. Queue for sprint planning

This is a complete backlog refresh operation.

get.description:
Get history of autonomous planning decisions.

Shows what the planner has done and why.
Get available autonomous operating modes.
Get current autonomous planning configuration.

post.description:
Run tests after a task completes.

This is the main endpoint for the test feedback loop.
It will:
1. Execute the test command
2. Parse and analyze results
3. Decide action (continue, retry, pause)
4. Create fix tasks if needed
5. Update sprint test gate

The sprint will be PAUSED if tests fail consistently.

- Overall pass/fail rate

Check whether the agent swarm engine is available.

post.description:
Execute a sprint through the LangGraph agent swarm.

The swarm uses specialised agents (Coder, Tester, Reviewer, Committer,
Diagnostician) coordinated by a Supervisor node. Failed tasks get
automatic diagnosis and model escalation (haiku  sonnet  opus).

Run full sprint lifecycle: audit  execute  plan next  sync UI.

This is the primary endpoint for autonomous sprint management.
Call it periodically or on-demand.

Force-plan the next sprint for a project.

Gathers failed tasks from recent sprints + approved ideas
and creates a new auto-execute sprint.

get.description:
Audit sprints and report status without executing anything.

Returns completed, failed, stale sprints and any detected errors.
Get the result of the last swarm/lifecycle execution.
